Posted By: Mindbend (9/24/2010 1:41:59 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Playing 4 copies of this, 4 copies of [Cloudpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudpost) and 4 copies of [Vesuva](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vesuva) nets you an absurd amount of mana and life. I've always been a fan of Cloudpost, but the "enters the battlefield tapped" thing can really be a hazzle when your opponent is ramming you with early creatures. Glimmerpost is a great help there, because it can give you additional time to set up your mana before you start throwing expensive things at your opponents.  
I could very well see [Cloudpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudpost), Glimmerpost and [Vesuva](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vesuva) working alongside [Eldrazi Temple](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eldrazi Temple) and [Eye of Ugin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eye of Ugin) to provide a solid mana base for Eldrazi decks in casual the casual environment.
posts.html:
Playing 4 copies of this, 4 copies of Cloudpost and 4 copies of Vesuva nets you an absurd amount of mana and life. I've always been a fan of Cloudpost, but the "enters the battlefield tapped" thing can really be a hazzle when your opponent is ramming you with early creatures. Glimmerpost is a great help there, because it can give you additional time to set up your mana before you start throwing expensive things at your opponents.
I could very well see Cloudpost, Glimmerpost and Vesuva working alongside Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin to provide a solid mana base for Eldrazi decks in casual the casual environment.

Posted By: GrimjawxRULES (9/30/2010 2:40:25 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I don't understand how anyone can think this is a bad card. Even without cloudpost, this thing snatches one life when it enters the field, and another two life if you play another. With all the artifacts flying around, unless your playing control or green, this thing is as good as colored mana. I put four in every standard deck unless they absolutely can't fit - It's only happened in tri-color control decks, none which work anyways.  
  
Oh, you expect a functional reprint of cloudpost, didn't you? That would be too much.  
  
Also, [crop rotation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=crop rotation) for instant life gain.

posts.post_content:
Lifegain with these and [cloudpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cloudpost) is pretty darn nice. Gaining 4-6 life for dropping a land really changes games. My deck that uses [Amulet of Vigor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amulet of Vigor) + [Izzet Boilerworks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Izzet Boilerworks) to bounce one of these guys out to gain more life.  
  
Use [Expedition Map](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Expedition Map) to speed out the Loci. Amulet of Vigor makes it free fast ;-)

Posted By: 1919 (9/23/2010 5:35:45 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It is amazing how much life gain advantage you can achieve with this. People who rate this less than a 5 most likely haven't seen it in action. At bare minimum you get a colorless land untapped and 1 life. Most of the time you'll be netting 3+ life out of these AND adding fuel to your cloudposts!  
  
Just compare it to [Kabira Crossroads](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kabira Crossroads).  
  
*Strictly* 5/5

posts.post_content: I actually like playing Ravinica bounce lands like [Gruul Turf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gruul Turf) with a [Cloudpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudpost) / [Glimmerpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimmerpost) set in play. Posted By: somegeek (8/22/2012 12:26:47 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Actually with a Primeval Titan is is possible to gain 12 life off of 4 of these. Put in 2 at the same time from the ETB trigger. When each of the GP ETBs trigger, you'll gain 2 life off of each trigger, for 4 life. On the next Primeval trigger, get the other 2, each of which triggers while all 4 are in play, result in 8 more life.  
  
4+8=12 life off of lands that you would get naturally anyway.
posts.html:

On the next Primeval trigger, get the other 2, each of which triggers while all 4 are in play, result in 8 more life.

4+8=12 life off of lands that you would get naturally anyway.
